discussion.discussion_content:
æ–‡ç« çƒ­è¯„ï¼šUmmmâ€¦ isnâ€™t SO part of the fact-based community? If soâ€¦ shouldnâ€™t an article about Flutter allegedly being the most popular cross-platform dev tool maybe offer some actual evidence? Beyond just a single graph about the number of SO questions about Flutter? Should it maybe be interested inâ€¦ how many people actually use Flutter? How many famous/significant apps are actually built on it? How many users those apps have? Stats from the world outside SO?

Further, since this is a site for developers, shouldnâ€™t an article about a dev tool maybe offer some evidence about why the developer (or user) experience is actually better (hence, â€˜more popularâ€™) than other options? In fact, shouldnâ€™t it maybe mention Xamarin, React-Native, etcâ€¦ _at all_?? Let alone why Flutter is actually a better option compared to those?

Ideally, shouldnâ€™t a blog post on the mighty SO read as something other than a fan-boy crush on the first cross-platform dev tool the writer has ever used, and a recitation of REALLY NEAT featuresâ€¦ which are for the most part possessed by all significant tools in the category?
